oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BREAKING WAVES IN SOFT ROCK CLIFF RECESSION IN SOUTH-WEST SARDINIA, IT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sulis, Andrea
Orrù, Paolo E.
Demurtas, Valentino
Atzeni, Andrea
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The rapid recession of soft cliffs has recently attracted considerable attention from civil engineers that have developed simplified models of the multiple factors that control the process. Sunamura (2012) provided a state-of- the-art review about present-day recession processes on soft-rock cliffed coasts, developing and applying a model derived from the reanalysis of previously published data. In this paper, an improvement of Sunamura’s model is proposed and applied to the cliff of Portu Maga, Sardinia (IT).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; sediment.105
